page.title: 09A Turkey Farm, Sodylt
page.content: This turkey farm raises 6,000 birds which{only}need to be fed twice a week on pellet food.The owner runs the farm by himself and the turkeys are not sold for meat but are kept for breeding and the production of eggs. The eggs are sold to hatcheries in various parts of the country.Lorries from hatcheries arrive to collect eggs twice a week.The main labour on the farm involves packing eggs in trays of 200. There are 7 acres of land and the birds are kept in large sheds.There are runs around the sheds which give protection against intruders like foxes which are a menace. The farm is out in the country and so the noise the birds make is not a nuisance to anyone. This farm is unique to the area, the nearest other being over 30 miles away
